comments.text: I think using different variables such as number of challenges, average challenge phase, number of people currently active (etc.) would make this really dynamic.

Clever if the burst behind is directly related to the number of inspirations, concepts, comments, participants, etc.  Though as OpenIDEO matures, I could see it quickly becoming a solid background!  Perhaps refreshed based on the particular challenges of the moment.

Love the exploding network visualization. The challenge is to make the word 'open' legible and clear. A good first step would be to make the word all the same color (perhaps white) and maybe a soft shadow will be enough to pop it out from the background...

need_an_idea_open_ideo..description: As my current project came to an end in Chicago, I tried to think about the steps involved when I start to design/brainstorm concepts: I think a little. I fiddle. I think some more. I draw. Alone this process is much less successful than when it is in the company of my team and colleagues. What if OPEN ideo was a way to get the best ideas out of all of us,  collaborations and inspirations that were always embedded underneath what we'd design in the end?
need_an_idea_open_ideo..creator: 039298e87ef38c11867b9f59c1814507
need_an_idea_open_ideo..title: Need an idea? OPEN ideo.

comments.text: Expresses the core value of the concept. Use the std IDEO logo and reverse (negative of) OPEN.

Nathan, you could try using the people sketches that Chris Long created for us.

Nathan, may be use the people (community) from this, and building on Soren's example where the people take up the space outside the letter's.  You could have interaction, some post its, (Soren's comment of having more ideas or comments, is great). I think the bigger the community the better.  This would look pretty cool.

I think this is a nice initial concept. I like the reference to people  however I think it could convey the experience more accurately. HMW express the social/human aspect of openIDEO? Perhaps there should be a reference to other forms of exchange beyond the face to face  such as comments, ideas, etc.
Got to use people!

comments.text: I'm a big fan of hand-drawn/written anything these days - and think the juxtaposition with the bold IDEO works incredibly well. A beautiful eye-pleasing job. well done!
Great job Martin. Love the new look! It inspires intellectual curiosity.

Congratulations Martin, as this is a clever idea of a dynamic logo conveying the collaboration and Always in Beta principles of open IDEO.If we were to restrict the logo to a single form (for printing purposes, etc.), I would have loved to see the concept of sticky note pads incorporated into the design.So that perhaps each letter of the word open will be drawn on a different colored pad, with the bottom right corner of the top pages slightly raised, giving the feeling that any minute someone might remove the top page idea in an attempt to reveal his own idea.
I love this. It makes me think of MIT's spotlight logos. Well done.
Exactly what it is meant to represent! Individuals' character and style! Love it! :)
A dynamic logo that reflects a dynamic organization. This is so cool.
Dynamic and Open branding. Absolutely reflects openness.
beautifully speaks the language of the website and the organization. jackpot!
Dig it. Dynamic/changing logos are great. Consistent with organization brand & stands on it's own. Nice work Martin.

Martin - while I like the idea, I personally have issues with light colored type in the readability arena, so I share a few thoughts generated from your concept. 1.  Can't draw, so leave this with you...O - circular, a wheel, Pen - a writing instrumentI - eyeball (vision)DEO - no clue - but links the circular start of the OWondered if drawings / icons should be looked at given pictures an international language.  More of a sign (language) vs. alpha-lingo.That all said, like your idea but would take care re the colors used in font.  Very hard to read screened back colors, esp Yellow on White.
Great logo. Love the simplicity. I definitely agree about the animation of it being written out; that would be very cool!

The idea about using different styles is obvious and great - the problem is, that the different logoes are done by the same person and by the same stroke and technique (handdrawn vector) etc - which doesn't express the announced variation. Make this variation by using different people to draw new "open"s.
can we do it alongside a more traditional "IDEO"?
yes yes yes!
love the fact that we would effectively have infinite permutations of the logo - perhaps submitted by the community themselves?
love the idea to animate these. would they rotate and cycle through the open's? love the handwriting...
I am applauding this not only because I like the work....but because it's called 'handjob 2'. nice.
I love the one on the bottom right - the proportions and the way it goes down at a slight angle are great. Would be cool to see some more versions of the rough handwritten ones.
Hi Martin, I love these. Would you consider animating them so they look like they are being written out by hand?
these could also be animated in flash if you wanted?

comments.text: Diego, I think the center of the "O" could potentially match any color "IDEO" logo text paired with it (e.g., grey or blue blocks). However, that said, I think the black void is pretty powerful; insert your contributions here! And, the simple black/white elements of the "O" logo seem to hold together regardless of the varied color images fed into the surrounding square. Any other ideas? I'd certainly be open to improvement...
I actually read the center part as a "black hole", as in space... could you do something with that treatment that isn't black?

Haiyan,The third file shows an early sketch of a web page with a logo type option (as first submitted by Jerry)  to the right of the O and within the banner. A bit heavy. I've also quickly explored a horizontal arrangement with my preferred logo type -- shown in the later files. I'm imagining that the IDEO blocks could change configuration playfully as the image field the big O lives in refreshes with a new image... What do you think?

Hi Chris, I love the very iconic 'O' and the vibrant graphic. Because the banner which houses the logo isn't very tall, we might also need a horizontal version. Do you have a horizontal layout in mind as well?

_201c_o_201d_is_for_open_a_logo_that_dyn.description: This concept activates the ‘O’ in IDEO. It borrows equity from the familiar IDEO logotype by recasting the simple letter O block (for Open, of course), and pushes it into a dynamic, continually refreshing, focal role. In this sketch, several quick variations of the ‘O’ are illustrated. As you can see, the central circle remains, but the square now frames an ever-changing visual surround that hints at current creative activity in the community.  This constantly updating logo-form may be fed by relevant selections from IDEO’s existing PhotoBase (leveraging key words) or ideally from rich visual contributions made by the OpenIDEO community during the inspiration phase of any challenge.

Hi everybody and thanks for your thoughts and contribution to this idea! I would suggest the first picture above to use for anything static/flat/print related. But depending on the use it would obviously need some tweaks (like how big the IDEO logo needs to be printable etc.). I also like the idea to use avatar images in the dynamic version on the website. This could happen for example if the user is on a user profile page or looking on the memberslist. Once we have a lot of content on openideo, it could also look through the associated tags of the page the user currently loos at and use images with similar context.
